meanings.definition: To formulate a new theory or set of theories.
meanings.sent1: She retheorizes the concept of gravity to include new variables.
meanings.sent2: The scientist retheorizes the origin of the universe based on new evidence.
meanings.sent3: The student retheorizes the idea of time travel for a school project.
meanings.sent4: The artist retheorizes the boundaries of art by incorporating unconventional materials.
meanings.sent5: He retheorizes the nature of happiness by exploring different philosophical perspectives.

meanings.definition: To reconsider or revise existing theories.
meanings.sent1: He often retheorizes his approach to solving math problems.
meanings.sent2: The professor retheorizes her hypothesis after conducting more experiments.
meanings.sent3: The team retheorizes their strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent4: She retheorizes her opinions on climate change after attending a seminar.
meanings.sent5: They retheorize the concept of leadership to adapt to changing circumstances.
